View Katakana Characters View Hiragana Characters Katakana Characters
Katakana is most often used for transcription of words from foreign languages, loanwords, or onomatopoeia to represent sounds. Hiragana Characters
Hiragana is used mainly for grammatical purposes. It is used on its own or in conjunction with kanji to form words. Basic Greetings & Phrases
Some basic Japanese greetings and phrases. View Basic Greetings Basic Greetings Japanese:	 はい
Romaji:			 Hai
English:		 Yes Japanese:	 いいえ
Romaji:			 Iie
English:		 No Japanese:	 おねがいします
Romaji:			 Onegai shimasu
English:		 Please Japanese:	 ありがとう
Romaji:			 Arigatō
English:		Thank you Japanese:	 どういたしまして
Romaji:			 Dōitashimashite
English:		 You're welcome Japanese:	 すみません
Romaji:			 Sumimasen
English:		 Excuse me Japanese:	 ごめんなさい
Romaji:			 Gomennasai
English:		 I am sorry Japanese:	 わかりません
Romaji:			 Wakarimasen
English:		 I don't understand Japanese:	 しりません 
Romaji:			 Shirimasen
English:		 I don\’t know Japanese:	 ただいま
Romaji:			 Tadaima
English:		 I have come back View Basic Phrases Basic Phrases Japanese:	 おはようございます
Romaji:			 Ohayō gozaimasu
English:		 Good morning Japanese:	 こんばんは
Romaji:			 Konbanwa
English:		 Good evening Japanese:	 おやすみなさい
Romaji:			 Oyasumi nasai
English:		 Good night Japanese:	 おなまえはなんですか？
Romaji:			 O-namae wa nan desu ka?
English:		 What is your name? Japanese:	 おげんきですか？
Romaji:			 O-genki desu ka?
English:		 How are you? Japanese:	 げんきです
Romaji:			 Genki desu
English:		 I'm fine. Thank you. Japanese:	 はじめまして
Romaji:			 Hajimemashite
English:		 Nice to meet you Japanese:	 ようこそ
Romaji:			 Yōkoso
English:		 Welcome Japanese:	 こんにちは
Romaji:			 Konnichiwa
English:		 Hello Japanese:	 さようなら
Romaji:			 Sayōnara
English:		 Goodbye
